definition: to visit one's friends and relatives
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear
parents-in-law of one's offspring
to visit/to call on/to seek/to inquire/to investigate
friend

sentences.english: People often visit their relatives and friends and eat many nice foods at Spring Festival.
sentences.chinese: 在春节，人们常走亲访友，吃很多甘旨食物。

sentences.english: Friends visit each other. And people wish each good luck.
sentences.chinese: 朋友们走亲访友并且祝福他人好运。

sentences.english: For example, go jogging every morning, Spring Festival walk in his relatives and friends.
sentences.chinese: 例如，每天早晨去跑步，春节里走亲访友。

sentences.english: In the past, people used to visit relatives and friends with gifts and lots of good wishes.
sentences.chinese: 在过去，人们常常会带着礼物走亲访友，互道祝福。
